subject: Clarification on calculation of Price Index Multiple in HAM Projects - reg.
text: HRdy 77ehy  <THRif gifearut 744 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (sm Wart &_{TTHTf 4d4) 9774 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) Mi-5 U 6, Vzr-10, ERaT, # feai-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/CPI(IW) adopted for HAM Projects Policy Circular No 8.4.22 Dated December,2020 (Decision taken on Agenda Item No. 442.12 in 442nd meeting of Executive Committee held on 16.10.2020) (Computer No. 41628) Sub: Clarification on calculation of Price Index Multiple in HAM Projects reg: Bid Project Cost is adjusted for variation between in Price Index occurring between the Reference Index Date preceding the Bid Date and the Reference Index Date preceding the date of   Invoice as per Clause 23.4 of the Model Concession Agreement. Price Index comprises (a) 70% of WPI; and (b) 30% of CPI (IW) 2 As per Article-42 of MCA, "CPI (IW) means the Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers aS published by the Labour Bureau, Government of India and shall include any index which substitutes the CPI (IW), and any reference to CPI (IW) shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed aS a reference to the CPI (IW) published for the period ending with the preceding quarter. 3 Labour Bureau publishes Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers for All India as well Centre wise index for various States. 4 It is clarified that centre wise CPI (IW) published for the circle in the State of the project shall be adopted for adjustment of Bid Project Cost as below: a) If the entire length of the project is in one State/UT, the CPI (IW) published for the Centre in the same State shall be adopted. b) In case there is no centre in a particular state where the projects is lying, the centre of the nearest State to the project highway be adopted. c) In case the project runs across more than one state, the centre of that state, which is having maximum project length be adopted. 5_ Further , it has been observed that various methodologies are being followed for calculating the Price Index Multiple_ It is hereby clarified that the Price Index Multiple should be calculated as per the below formula: Where, CPI1 CPI (IW) for Reference Index preceding the Bid Date WPI1 WPI for Reference Index preceding the Bid Date CPI2 CPI (IW) for Reference Index preceding the Invoice Date WPI2 = WPI for Reference Index preceding the Invoice Date For example, if CPI1 102.7 WPI1 200.4 CPI2 110.8 WPI2 = 205.5 Cont. to Pg-2 (4T M RI 4 NHAI 2nd
